definition: wasted effort
surname Fu
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
surname Zhu
all/various
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: One season of apples down the drain.
sentences.chinese: 一季的苹果就这样付诸东流。

sentences.english: Well, they go down the drain if you don’t have disability insurance.
sentences.chinese: 那么，如果你没有伤残保险，他们付诸东流。

sentences.english: I'm afraid this sudden wet weather has put paid to our picnic.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这突如其来的雨天已使我们的野炊付诸东流了。

definition: to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
to come to nothing (idiom)
to go up in smoke/to vanish
to waste (one's energy etc)
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to pay for sth with the loss of (one's health etc)/to have sth come at the cost of (one's reputation etc)
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc)/ruined
to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
to build up an enterprise through painstaking efforts
to hold a funeral procession and burial/to give sb a final send-off/(fig.) to ruin (one's future prospects etc)
lit. froth and shadows/fig. illusion/mirage
to lose/to miss
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to put to the torch (idiom)/to commit to the flames/to burn sth down deliberately
using a wicker basket to draw water (idiom); wasted effort
